Got a notification from this app suggesting I might need an umbrella today. Went to the app and there was no rain in the forecast. Apparently they just wanted me to open the app, and I consider that spam. Uninstalled.

I am constantly seeing differences in the information being displayed in one section vs. another section. e.g. UV Index might be 2 in one section and 3 in another area. It's like each section is getting it's forecast from a different source.

I got this app about 2 years ago based on friends using it and it was on point for precip temp. Now however it says it's going to rain on the current day forecast but usually says '0' on the weekly forecast

I have checked out other apps and concluded that AccuWeather is the best in most aspects. I have checked out the accuracy with the other apps and found that all were in agreement. The only thing that makes the temperature inaccurate with all the apps is that I selected Shelton, WA, but they use Olympia which is 16 miles away. Therefore the temperature is a little inaccurate. Overall I am happy with AccuWeather.

I love accuweather. Compared to other weather apps this app has been the most reliable and accurate. However the widget has an annoying bug. It has text doubled over other text and the temperature seems not to be updating regularly. But I'm not entirely sure of that because I cannot read it because there is text over the number.
I would also like to know where it is connected to that it is getting readings from. It is no where close to any of the reading in this area that I live in.
Its a good app but the widget has some bugs on iPhone 7

Minutecast says no precipitation for 120 minutes, but when I look at hourly it says 59 chance of snow in the next hour.  It had chances of snow between 4060 for a four hour period.  It never did snow during that time.

Not very accurate in eastern Pa. Will show that it's raining but the description says rain starting in 15 minutes. I believe it relies on it's information from airports so the further away you are from that airport the less reliable it will be
Occasionally the reading for  chance of precipitation and degrees are swapped in error, but quickly switching between them fixes it.
One annoying thing about this app is that no matter what I do it shows me in a city 35 miles south of where I am, with a mile high mountain in the way the weather is very different.
Reported 2 years ago that it won't keep my location address. Still not tracking right. It's showing weather for my zip code but several miles away on some street at least 2 miles away.

So if you want a really good looking weather app, this is it. In terms of actually forecasting the weather, the summaries are a bit too sparse.  In terms of general quality, it's below average, because the widget problem should have been caught in development  it's that obvious if you use it for a while.

The AccuWeather app used to be quite accurate, but a year or two ago changes were made which have greatly deteriorated the quality of the forecasts.  Even with a specific address in place the Minutecast shows rain when it is not raining and no rain or coloration on the map when it is.  The temperatures are off by 810 degrees.  The wind speed is accurate only part of the time.  The new app is also less user friendly.  I use the old one to check on the month as a whole but that's about it.  This app serves for a very general picture if the weather... hot, cold, windy .... but it does not reflect actual weather anymore then the NOAA does.  I find that Weather Underground is the most reliable and specific weather app here in Rio Rancho, NM.

The app is very accurate but the only thing that bothers me is when there is rain in the forecast. Usually it will say there's a 50 chance of rain, sometimes it can be frustrating when trying to plan a work day outdoors. Besides the the projected future forecast seem to be fairly accurate up to a week or so and it's very helpful.

The bad thing is that the daily forecast summary is pretty sparse.  Some might think that this is a good thing. But it can be off.  For example tomorrow's forecast calls for Mostly cloudy with a shower. Problem is that according to all of the local TV news forecasts, what is really going to happen is Passing cold front in the morning, bringing a chance of light sprinkles and or snow flurries in the early morning to late morning. Clearing in the afternoon.
The weather now is rarely accurate. Quite frustrating. Temperature is often wrong. This is unacceptable and needs 2 be fixed immediately

The filters offered within this application are really quite fun. When I choose to post a picture, I find myself applying all of the filters to see which one I like best. Since you have to select each filter individually and wait for the processing, this can be time consuming. There are some hidden features, in the sense that it's not obvious they are there. You can drag you finger left right on the image to change the intensity of the effect. You can swipe down to create a split screen and move it around but it's a little clumsy. Also, if you want to save the image and post it, those are individual steps instead of selecting multiple actions at once. There is one thing I am unhappy about. You can't change the location assigned to a posted image and they use your current location instead of the location the photo was taken. Since I tend to up load photos once I am home, the location information is always incorrect. I would like the ability to apply the filters on my computer. I'm going to try and print some of the images just to see what happens. I really like the idea of this application, but it's not a mature offering yet.
The ability to mask out the effect on the background or foreground with a single click is magical.

The lag time for processing isn't too bad considering the nature of the filters, but it could be better. Also, it is difficult to adjust the intensity of the effects it's rather haphazard trying to even get it to pull up. Overall, 45 for it's features you can't really customize an effect that I can see and 35 for functionality. It's discouraging to use the app with all it's potential if it keeps crashing. I'd rather the developers improve the features already present and their functionality before introducing anything new.

This app is good, but there's an annoying side bar that has a mind of its own. If you slide your finger in another active app to flip through a page, Adobe's Acrobat side bar opens up. It would be nice to disable this unnecessary feature, but so far I haven't found a say to do it.

I have traded emails with Adobe support. The popup side bar can be deactivated by going to the multitasking tab in iOS General tab and turning off Multitasking. When multitasking is turned on, a user can be using an application and do a side swipe that theoretically will show all other apps that function in split screen. If I open Safari and do this, only Acrobat pops up in that list and shows all the documents linked to Acrobat. When I open Acrobat and do a side swipe, several apps show up in that side bar. This leads me to believe the issue isn't Acrobat related, but iOS related.
Thanks to the Adobe staff for helping me resolve this.

Like a previous reviewer, I was sick of this app opening on the right side anytime I got close to swiping anything on the right part of my iPad screen.  An Adobe Acrobat sidebar opens and I see a list of my locally saved documents.

The previous reviewer indicated that Adobe offered a fix of turning off Multitasking under the general tab.  That would be fine if you definitely don't want any multitasking to show up.  But here's the thingWhile Acrobat is installed, no other apps will show up if you swipe from the right  only Acrobat.  If you are in Acrobat and swipe from the right, you can see the apps that are normally supposed to show up as part of multitasking.  It looks like a nice feature.  The problem is, you can't have that feature and Acrobat too.
For now I will turn off multitasking because if I delete Acrobat, I lose my documents.  After I take the time to back them up in another app, then I will dump Acrobat until they fix this situation.
The other reviewer decided it was the fault of iOS, but I have to disagree.  At the very least, Acrobat should find a way to turn off their own multitasking within their own app.

I like the App itself. The games are good and seem to do what they state. My problem is with the description. When I purchased it through the App Store, it clearly states that it allows Family Share. The description doesn't state that a Family account has to be purchased on Lumosity's website NOT through the App Store. So I purchased the year subscription because the price is significantly cheaper, only to find out later that you can ONLY purchase the family account through Lumosity's website or if you purchased it through the App Atore you have to email them to set it up. I emailed them 3 days ago only to get the useless email below
Unfortunately, it is not currently possible to upgrade subscriptions purchased via iTunes, so there is not a way to purchase the Family Plan on your existing subscription.

However, you can purchase a Family Plan when your current subscription ends. If you'd like to start a Family Plan then, you should turn off recurring billing in iTunes so that your current individual subscription won't renew. Then, after your current subscription has ended, you can purchase a Family Plan.

Basically I'm screwed until next year and the only way I can set up an account for my son, who needs it for ADHD and working memory, is to get another subscription OR wait until next year. Brilliant suggestion. Thanks for the help .

Ellie Shorb of Compass is one of the best real estate representatives I have ever dealt with. I had been trying to get my house ready for sale for over a year.

Our neighborhood was selling at good prices  my ultimate goal of buying in Florida was reachable with a new housing boon, topped off by low interest rates. And I had been struggling with an autoimmune disorder for years, making a warmer climate change in the right direction.

Ellie helped me prepare for the sale of my home by providing contacts among her vast number of vendors. Those with established relationships, either by working with her clients or those of associates of hers  even more trustworthy, those used by herself, her family  close circle of friends.
She kept the ball rolling towards my endgoal, between my dealing with family illness, death  a few hospital stays myself. She made her job seem effortless  the process, seamless.

It was like having a member of the family working with you. Instant, yet deserved trustworthiness, mixed with reliability, accountabilityhers, along with anyone associated with achieving the goaland ultimately, SUCCESS.

My house was under contract within 3 weeks of being listed  the Open House. The 2 weeks before that, through her networks, there was a revolving door of buyer's agents taking a peek, at my home for their clients before it hit the market

I consider myself extremely lucky to have had such a great realtor working for  with me throughout this process. And now, someone I would not only highly recommend, but someone I would call a friend. Ani Diaz

I would like to point out that Filipino is NOT a language, it's an ethnicity. The main dialect in the Philippines is called Tagalog. I've been using the English to Chinese translation to help learn certain words and characters, but I've come to notice that direct translations can only get you so far. The differences in grammar and sentence structure for languages prevents any app from seamlessly transforming something from one language to another. Also, you may get a different translation depending on the structure of your input phrase, so make sure that the translation you receive is in the correct tense and word form.

Flaws aside, this app does have a really useful feature that allows you to access languages offline through a download as well as save certain wordphrase translations. However, if you save too many different translations, it becomes difficult to manage, as there is no way to organize the translations. They are simply sorted according to the order in which they were saved. It would be extremely helpful to be able to organize them alphabetically or manually.

A marvelous language survival kit. Excellent convenience with ability to download language for offline translation. Accepts typed and spoken input. Doesn't go crazy with ads and quirks like other translation apps. Love this app
I use Google Translate a lot, and in the past it's been pretty useful. However, there's room for improvement.
First of all, I think there should be a wider variety of languages and dialects. I find it very annoying that I can't translate Certain languages to other certain languages.

Second of all, whenever I translate certain foreign words to English, the translation is Wrong. For instance, I've tried multiple times to translate the Bulgarian word '' transliteration Bulgarski, translation Bulgarian to English, it said it meant 'English'. Obviously, something isn't right. And I, several times, have translated 'The Squad Goes out' in English to Hebrew, but the Hebrew translation says 'The Class is Dismissed'. Please fix it.
And I've noticed that when I type in 'Deus Vult', which is Latin for 'God Wills', it doesn't translate from Latin. It translates from Portuguese. Fix this.

When I speak in German to have it translated to English sometimes I have to think for a second of the word I want but it assumes I'm finished and translates an incomplete sentence. Very annoying. I think they need to put a longer delay on it so it doesn't translate it after 0.5 seconds of silence.  If we spoke a second language perfectly we wouldn't be using the app or needing to pause for a second to think of the word.  An easy fix which many would find very valuable.  Or an even better fix is to have an option to simply turn automatic translation off.  This way when the user is finished heshe can hit translate and voil.

I'm in American who lives in Mexico fulltime. I moved here in March from Texas. This application lets me do everything that I've ever dreamed of and more as a Spanish conversion application. For example, I can dictate a phrase or an email in English and it converts into Spanish for me in real time. I can enter into Spanish word and it converts it to English. I can use the photo feature on this and take a picture of text in Spanish and it converts it in real time in English. It also does pronunciations so I can continue to practice my Spanish.  In short, I've never seen a thing like this and I am completely thrilled. I've never written a review for an application although I'm a long time Apple user. And I'm happy to report this is a five out of five application.  PS I have taught my 71yearold mother how do use this application as well. And she loves it Thomas in San Miguel Mexico

Pokmon go, is an awesome game, but apparently Niantic isn't very concerned about how many people play their game because of the recent updates. All this began when the time for Pokmon to spawn was changed from 5 to 10. Not a big deal, it was still fun and promoted walking. Then, there was a small grace period before they released their second fatal  update. They scrapped their tracking system. SERIOUSLY THEY REMOVED THE ONLY WAY TO FIND POKMON ACCURATELY That also removed all third party scanners, which literally was the only reason most of the players actually went to catch Pokmon. But more advanced trackers like FPM survived. Then they killed any form of hope by adding a captcha robot detector feature. Which removed all the advanced third party scanners. Being able to actually know where the Pokmon I wanted to catch were was the only reason I played Pokmon go. But I still played for a while by riding my bike and running certain trails. But then, the final straw was when Pokmon ceased to appear if you walked, ran or biked too fast. Now, all I can do in Pokmon go is walk around at the speed of Old man to catch a pidgey or two. Or if I'm lucky, a rare and elusive rattata. That's how much I care at this point. Pokmon go lost like 90 of its players because of Niantic's wrong decisions. Also, seriously, the buddy system is is complete and total garbage. Let me walk 5km to get 1 candy for my eevee And don't forget about Pokmon go's high end nearby tracking system. Which is completely broken. There was a koffing on the last slot which means it was the farthest away and suddenly it appears right in front of me. All in all, I don't think Niantic even cares about this game anymore. They removed key features and made the game unplayable.

I have been playing Pokmon Go since release, me while I am a huge fan, I need Niantic to get their act together and help out us rural players. I am going to list out all of the things wrong with rural playing, and give pointers on how to fix.

First of all, spawns are an absolute joke out in rural areas. Since then you have increased spawn rates, however all that has accomplished is increase the amount of crappy Pokmon that I come across. Please Niantic, increase RARER spawns, because even a rock or fire Pokmon gets me excited at this point.

Second of all, while the new gym system is MUCH improved from the older system, it still has its flaws. The first is the 50 coin max, as the limited gyms in these areas are always changing hands. That way, is you hold a gym for longer it's really an accomplishment OUT in rural areas, yet no real reward is given. The other thing that needs to be changed is less about rural areas, but if more then one Pokmon get knocked out in the same day, only the first rewards coins. This feature is absolutely ABSURD considering we still worked to get those other gyms, yet get no reward.

The third feature that needs changing is raids. I love the feature, as it has already helped me to get several new Pokmon. HOWEVER, in rural areas, good raids are far and few between. So when I find something like a Snorlax or Tyranitar raid I get really excited. That's all well in good, except for the fact that their cp is too high to beat without any other players nearby, remember that rural thing so I have never beaten ANY OF THEM Still don't have A Tyranitar

The fourth is being led into by my third, and that is the new legendary raids. Legendaries have been hyped up ever since the game came out, and not only am I sorely disappointed but I will never get one. Again, good raids are far and few between, so finding a legendary raid is hard enough. Then I can never beat one because there are no players that play near me to help with the raid. And say that for some reason I actually do complete a raid which I won't then the catch rate is THREE PERCENT To make it fairer, I think they should do two things. One of which is a suggestion and the other is something that absolutely needs to happen. I think a good idea would be that the legendary raid cp should not be a determined thing, and should be created by the amount of people who are in the actual raid. That way it would still be really hard, but not impossible for rural players to complete. The other thing that needs to be implemented is the increasing catch rate of legendaries to at least 15 considering beating them is hard enough. Maybe they could also have an event where all of the already released legendaries are put in raids and their cp cut in half if they don't do the auto scaling cp.
Again, I love the game but they need to better scale it towards rural players just as much people in the cities. Please    recomment any of my suggestions that you find fitting so Niantic can see

Pokmon Go is notorious for its overabundance of Pidgeys, Ratattas, Weedles, Venonats, Sentrets, and Spinaraks.  The game alerts players as to which types of Pokmon can be found in the wild at a given time and place, some of which are such rare spawns you hardly get to find them anywhere else.  Every single time, I'm let down by the Nearby list because my radar is flooded with these overabundant Pokmon I've listed above instead of the spawns the list had promised.

The only way to make progress in Pokmon Go is to catch several, sometimes hundreds, of duplicates of the same species of Pokmon to gain Candies, Stardust, and EXP.  But if all but 10 species are readily accessible to catch in the wild, there's no ability for users to catch different species andor make them stronger.

I propose that the Pokmon on the Nearby list should spawn in the wild predictably and promisingly.  I cannot count how many times the silhouette of a somewhat rare Pokmon has appeared on the list and have been lost to the abyss that is random spawning.  Please make this happen, Niantic.  Us in the suburbs cannot walk casually from interesting place to interesting place as you could in the city.

Handsdown the best app for the Apple Pencil and iPad Pro. It can seem intimidating at first, but there are plenty of online resources to help you learn, and once you have a basic understanding of how to use it, you'll start creating amazing artwork. I get that the developers of this app position it mostly as a drawing app, however, some useful tools like text tool, or just rectangle, just some standard things that almost every drawing app has by now are missing here. And seems like they are nowhere to be find in the near future, which is a bit frustrating.

This app is virtually flawless  and the only thing keeping it from being my go to drawing tool is the lack of additional technical tools. Give me a ruler, give me an ellipse guide, give me a rectangle tool. This is the one area that apps such as Sketchbook Pro really shine  it has great art tools, and great tools that support the art tools. Procreate has exceptional art tools, but lacks any additional tools to support those art tools  and in my opinion, this is what causes Procreate to fall a bit short. The addition of the new draw assist tool in SBP was a total game changer  being able to ink panels on the fly and illustrate flawless ellipses, lines, squares, etc has made that app PERFECT for both rapid concepting and professional production level art. Procreate will dominate once it has a broader toolset than just customizable brushes.

The brushes are very customizable, and this app has a professional feel. However, I feel as if this app is best for people trying to draw traditionalesque painting, not comics or similar styles. There are lineart tools, but what would make this app more accommodating would be features like clipping layers, alpha lock, a paint bucket tool, and a selection layer where you can draw on selection instead of just using the lasso tool. I haven't explored this app completely but I'm pretty sure it doesn't have those tools. Other than that, it's perfect for sketching and painting  as the app advertises.

Procreate is beautiful and fluid in almost every way that an illustrative app could be. The brushes are incredible and I'm so excited to be able to customize and import new brushes outside of the basic set.
It's user friendly interface is fantastic A beginner would find their feet very well in this program and thrive.
With that said there are a few tools that I'm surprised not to see on such a richly developed app.

There isn't a crop tool which I find to be quite a bummer because personally, I don't know how I want my piece to be framed off until the end of the process. I could take it to another editing app and take care of it there but I'd prefer this to be all inclusive.
There's no type tool.

I know that this has been addressed many times, but I'm going to throw my opinion in there too. Graphic illustrator argument aside, implementing text is a gold mine text would help expand the appeal of this app to many different consumers and creative groups
That's another huge bummer. There are brushes out there that are shaped like rectangles and circles but again it's really inconvenient.
I'm not saying that this needs to have smartfill or anything, but these tools are incredibly important to even the most basic of drawing apps.
Again, I love this app It's a lovely and easy piece of gold for you and your Apple Pencil but it's important to hear what your consumers are missing in the product they love so much.

Procreate is officially my favorite illustrating application and it's really my initial recommendation for other artists who want to experiment. It may have a few cons here and there but overall it's a great app I do have recommendations of some sorts but I'll get to that later.
Organization  The app itself is organized, the clean look and theme makes it a clean workplace to work on.

Brushes  The brush settings are what I've been looking for my entire life, settings that actually affect the brush The number of brushes are remarkable, each with their own texture. The ability to make and import custom brushes was a great touch, I'm honestly grateful for it.
Canvas Measurements  Thank goodness, I don't have to struggle converting pixels into whatever unit anymore, they're also effective and I love them.
Palette Customization  This feature is so smooth, I can just tap instead of drag or whatever else is excessive. It's so easy to just create palettes or artworks.
Adjustments  The best feature actually,  I have never seen an IOS application with the adjustments. e.g Gaussian Blur

SelectionLasso Tool  The Lasso Tool the tool with the S for an icon is useful in coloring in my opinion. However, freehand selection is often risky since you have to continue along. It would be nice to have a magnetic lasso tool like in Adobe Photoshop CC for people with unsteady hands like myself to use. Also a Select Pen should be added, like the one present in Medibang Paint, it would really help in coloring finer details since Automatic Selections tend to leave a few pixels, leaving the user to have to fill it in manually.

So far, I appreciate the app, though it could use a couple more upgrades here and there. The Magnetic Lasso and the Select Pen is what I'm really looking out for if there will be a future update for the app.

I remember playing video games back in the late 1970's when the fun was the ability to control the character on your television screen.
Back then, the graphics were not so detailed, but at least you could control the character.
Sadly, Nintendo took away the fundamental ability to control the character of Mario so I am not using this app anymore. How is it a game when I can't control the character? Bring back how it was.
You can't control anything but the ability to jump. Please add more features.
Your mission is to collect all pink, then all purple, then all black coins in each and every level of the game.
Trial and error is what to expect in this craziness as some of the more difficult coins require absolute perfectly timed jumps. Please make it more easier to use.
Good luck with THAT
After beating the first twelve challenges in the first four levels, I shopped at Walmart for the purchase of a New 3DS XL with power adapter and the smash hit New Super Mario Bros. 2.
Although this game is pretty restrictive, I upgraded my rating because while it requires an active internet connection, it doesn't use much data.
The Toad Rally is pretty interesting and you can add friends to challenge them.
When you link this game to your Nintendo Network account, you get allot of rewards.
I have decided to purchase this game and add another  to my rating.
While this game is pretty restrictive, it does offer quite a bit of entertainment value with daily challenges.
Don't think of this game as a real game rather a challenge.
Keep in mind that no iPhone game will ever compare to a real video game system.
In conclusion this game is nothing more than an interactive advertisement for their premium systems and games.
Recommended Only if you WANT a valid excuse to purchase a Nintendo game system like I recently did.

I have completely enjoyed this game all the way through It was worth every penny If you didn't buy it then you have no room to complain.

I have collected every item and every coin and have enjoyed every second of it. The game is more than just tapping the screen, there is actual strategy involved. The great thing about the game is that it has challenges for all skill levels, just like most MARIO games do. The beginner will not be turned off while the hardcore player will enjoy the challenges associated with collecting all the coins, Toads, items and playing Rally Mode against tougher competitors.

You can't beat what you get for 10. Most of us gamers will go out and pay at least 60 for a new game and not give it a second thought, but the moment they charge 10 for an app everyone is up in arms. Pay the price and give it a chance There's a lot more to this game than what you see at first glance

Now, the biggest flaw that I have found thus far. When you max out your Toads it will make it extremely difficult to collect more Toads of a certain color. If you are like me, you have collected everything but the 2500 Toads required to obtain the classic Luigi statue. Every time you win a rally it will appear you have been given the appropriate amount of Toads, but check again. I usually only get about half of the color Toad it says I got when I win a rally while I'm maxed out. This made it very difficult to get the 2500 green toads I needed. I was finally able to achieve it by losing a few rallies on purpose that didn't require betting any green Toads, but it took way longer than it should have. Nintendo, please fix this bug, or please remove the Toad limit

Overall, it's a fantastic game I would have given it 5 stars if it weren't for the annoying maxed out Toad bug. Maybe Nintendo will fix that and I will change my review. Until then it's a solid 4 star game and worth the price
Edit Nintendo removed the toad limit and now everything is right with the world As promised I changed me review to a 5 star. Thanks for listening Nintendo

I use Enlight in an indie capacity to improve my IG and FB pics on vacations and professional game development excursions, and the app has been essential to my work for about two years.  The tutorials are super helpful and it was worth the few dollars I originally spent on it.

So I usually never bother to write reviews but this app blew me away. I would say it even rivals professional tools like photo shop. They might have more control but Enlight is so easy to use that I would much rather use it more than any thing else.

Some of the features that I've tested were very cool. It looks like you can create amazing art with this, however, it is not very intuitive. Still trying to figure out how to end a session and start a new one. I'm sure the information is available, just how deep will you need to dig to uncover it, who knows. But once you have it figured out, it's going to be a great tool.

They have intentionally broken the legacy app. I have never seen a developer take away something  tools one already had in a previous version. This is a new low in the pursuit of revenue. I would urge you to not use Enlight as it would encourage this kind of behavior in other developers. Just delete Enlight and move on. Quality photo editing apps are a dime a dozen and for a monthly subscription there certainly are much higher quality editors out there than Enlight. In any case you decide. Very best to all.

After contacting support and following their repair instructions the app is back to being fully functional. I extend my apologies to the developers for my bombastic review. I should have contacted support before jumping to conclusions. Embarrassing Yes. Humbling Yes.

After trying many of the other 7minute workout apps, I conclude that this one is my personal favorite, note the personal. Most of the other one require you to pay for other features when this app gives it after the initial purchase. The workout itself is amazing because I can keep my device turned off and the workout will still continue. The addons in this app are also great, but I feel like the initial workout is enough. The reasons why I gave this a 45 instead of a 55 is because of the lack of updates and the improvements there could be on the app to accommodate more recent devices, like the iPhone 6 or 7. Since it is out of date, the app drains a bit more battery on newer devices than it does on older ones your device will send you a notification of this issue when using the app as a reminder. In the end, this is a very good app for those who, like myself, do not have the time to workout for long periods of time in an expensive gym. I would definitely recommend this app to anyone.

Just recently we had a mild tornado outbreak, as well as a slew of severe thunderstorms. Of all of the apps that I have for weather with the notifications turned on, NOAA was the very last app to give me a notification that the storm was happening, and at times that notification was almost an hour after the storm had passed. If this was the only app that I had giving me notifications, my family and myself could have wound up seriously injured or worse if just one of those tornado producing storms had hit my house and I was relying on this app. The sad thing is that this is a paid app, that I purchased for a little bit of reassurance during bad weather to give me some piece of mind and the only thing it has done is make me more weary about severe weather in my area. And for anyone that reads this and is wondering, this has not been the only time that the app has been extremely delayed in letting me know that there was bad weather approaching. It happened in April, as well as January, during the tornado outbreak across GA. So basically, it's not a fluke.

Don't know why they can't locate us and give accurate weather.

This app has always had two significant issues that make it impractical. 1. It always starts incredibly zoomed in, meaning you have to pinch zoomout several times to see incoming weather. I don't know about you, but I can usually tell if it's raining at my current location by opening my eyes. I need to know what's on the way, not what's already here. 2. When you begin zooming out, your city's name pops up in a bubble that covers the city and, in my case, a significant portion of my state. This blocks my view of the weather itself. And I live in a rather large Midwestern state, so it's ridiculous that the city name scales larger and larger as you zoom out, covering the state. It's just bad design, and I don't know why no one else is bothered by the poor functionality and lack of customization. This isn't worth 4.

That's right it doesn't give you a forecast for today. And if I hadn't watched the weatherman this morning I wouldn't know today has the potential of having a severe weather outbreak. Forecasts for days in the future consist of two words at most. Inexplicably Saturday is forecast as 'Clear.' But the chance of rain is 70. Tomorrow shows 'Light rain.'  Chance of rain, 0. Makes no sense. Why this app gets such a high rating is a mystery to me. If you live an area where severe weather is common don't get this. Even if you don't it's poorly done.

I personally would like this app to have an option to turn on H.A. Rey's constellation lines, which are extremely useful because of combining advantages of maximum correspondence of constellation images to their names and of using only real stars and, hence,  the ability to find the abovementioned cool images in the sky. The starattaching lines, used on this app, have no sense for me, and that's why I use them only to differentiate one constellation from another.

I really don't understand why the average rating of this app is only 2 stars. I've tried them all. Gboard, Swift Key, Flexsy, Wordflow, and IGIF to name a few. But if the thing that matters most to you is being able to Swype when you text then this app is for you. And NO responses from the developers They've killed themselves...
HINTWorkaround folks for the freezing issue.
Go to settings, general, keyboard, keyboards, Swype and toggle Allow Full Access. Viola It'll start working. Then go back and toggle it off again. Serious security flaw, oh right... Feature.

And if any developers from Swype ever read these things  Check your code for security violations This is why toggling access works. It resets whatever bad call you've made that iOS is blocking and locking up your app.

I have always been a pretty big fan of these types of sliding, swiping keyboards and Swype is the best available on iOS in my opinion right now.

Though, to me, the ultimate and best swiping keyboard, back from my Android phone days, was Shapewriter. There just was nothing better available anywhere, it was the absolute creme of the crop in my book.

Unfortunately, Nuance Communications, the makers of this Swype keyboard, bought out the Shapewriter keyboard IPcompany back then.  And shut it down and took it off the Market. For what seems to me to be to kill off a really big competitor at the time, which was seriously unfortunate in my opinion.  And I've never found a swiping keyboard since that, that matched Shapewriter's awesome abilities and ease of use.  But, Swype, does come in at a close second I think.

I digress though.  I really just would appreciate it if, Nuance, would update this application soon please.  Because it's acting a little grumpy recently in some of my programs that I use it in.  Like Notability for instance.  And it's been a while since this developer has appeared to touch Swype.
I sure hope that they haven't abandoned this application.  It hasn't been long enough since the last update to conclude that in my opinion.  But the time since the last update has me a bit concerned.

So, thanks to Nuance for this great app and please update the program soon to make it fully compatible with other applications and especially with the latest iOS build, please.  And as I said, I just do not believe that you can find a better slidingswiping keyboard on iOS.  Thanks for bringing this superb tool to Apple and God bless.

Would you also please bring out some fun and stylish new keyboard themes for Swype as well.  I think that it would be great to have some themes that had an effect that made each key light up when pressed or swiped.  I would be grateful and appreciate it if you would consider adding new themes please, and thank you if you do so.

Very impressed with improvements. The old versions you would have to switch to the Swype keyboard before every use. Now that that's fixed its really nice now.

I had a Swype keyboard on my last LG phone and I truly can never go back. I always had a hard time punching out words with the tiny tiles and then this happened and I can respond as fast as or faster than I can receive. It's truly the most wonderful keyboard and I can't imagine typing on a mobile device without it. I bought this despite the bad reviews because it was my favorite Android keyboard. Figured the problems couldn't be nearly as bad as the reviews made it out to be. Huge mistake, this keyboard is AWFUL.
After this sentence, I'll stop making corrections and instead put the correct words in parentheses to show how bad the predictions are.

Weird words tired typed mostly on one line give this keyboard fits. The avoid android version eventually learns and gets better. This doesn't. It also rarely had has the right word in the list of choices, so you have to toe type it manually, or make really exaggerated stored swipes so it figures it out. It also likes to change stuff after Macias manual typing, wasting tins tons of time.

Typing numbers is another major problem. You can't long press keys to get digits like android, and the keyboard goes back to Keyes letters after one number. Do so it takes two keepers keypresses per number.

There's also dine some weird bus bugs like inserting 'b' or 'q' keeps keypresses at the start of typing, and freezing up. Thought I was accidentally doing it, but I just watched as I pressed the 'c' button and it inserted 'bc'.
This is a poor imitation of the Android version. Don't be fooled like I wss was, Dave save your money avg and skip this trash.
It's learning algorithm needs serious work. I've had to manually type half of this because it's given me words that aren't even close.
You don't get access to the full emoji keyboard without switching to the stock Apple emoji keyboard.
It's extremely hard to contact the developers.
Updates are few and far between.
Can't even use themes unless you pay for them
Unfriendly user , useless features, overall waste of money, time , and even storage space on my sixty gigabit phone

I loved my Windows Phone, but as a prepaid user, options were nil... even for a Windows Phone user. Nice being current and relevant when it comes to apps after switching to iPhone, but the default keyboard is awful. Swype makes typing a dream. I can spit out message faster and more accurate with Swype, and without that nasty as carpal tunnel to boot. Well worth the price. Really don't understand the negative review here. Swype is perfect.

Even with all autocorrect off and the Apple dictionary disabled, Swype still generates nonsensical words.  That, it freezes on the numeric keyboard input, requiring a hard rest of my iPhone 6 to correct.
I'm looking for a different app.

The actual input of swype odd great, but the increase in unresolved bugs and small irritating nuances have become too annoying to keep using. I will delete the app after this review but I'm hoping for improvements down the road.

Biggest issue is the keyboard crashes and doesn't appear frequently safari, messaging, other apps. Usually takes 30 seconds of random touchesclosing and reopening of apps before it comes back. And there is no way to switch keyboards when this happens. This started last year and hadn't gotten any better.

Second most annoying is the keyboard switch. I use other keyboards with unique capabilities but switching between is annoying because only the swype keyboard requires a long press. And it's in a different location that every other keyboard including the default Apple keyboard. And it launches a menu instead of just switching keyboards.
Swiping has always been great. Even really approximaterough swipes will typically surprise me and get the write word or give me the right word in the list of three closest guesses.
Autocorrect is getting better. Updates have allowed easier learningentering of unique phrases.

Love swipe but A constant issue with iphone 6 is my keyboard reverts back to the stock key board every time I send a new text. They fix it but every time a new iOS comes out, it happens again. Don't get me wrong it's the only key board I use. Just wish they would fix it faster when there is an iOS update..... Update apr 2017, please update for iPhone 7 program is misspelling words constantly.
FiX this bug it's ridiculous. It happens a lot on safari and chrome. It happens sometimes on the messages app too. IPhone 7 plus Verizon.

I really like this app... the only problem is... that on Safari and Google app... it shows a blank area where the keyboard should be... why.. the other browser apps .. Bing... Opera Mini... DuckDuckGo... Dolphin Pro... Puffin... and Yandex, it works fine.. no issues.. When are you going to fix this ..  I hope that you do... sorry I can only give you 2 stars...
I've always loved Swype. But, I have similar complaints as some of the other reviews.

I have autocorrect off. Just auto spacing. So when I add punctuation after pressing the 123 key, I expect the word to stay the same. Not be autocorrected to a completely different word. It's very frustrating. I usually have to hit space and then add the punctuation. It'll usually correct itself and addon the punctuation to that sentence then. Just inconvenient tho.

It also freezes A LOT. I'll be texting and it freezes. Or typing in something on safari. It freezes to the point where I actually need to shutdown my iphone. It just won't let me type. My phone doesn't freeze, the Swype keyboard freezes. So it's obviously the app.
I've contemplated just using the regular keyboard now. It's more time consuming using Swype.
Read on, new or potential users, this review isn't all bad news and complaints

This would be a 5 star review if I didn't need to reinstall the keyboard just to finish typing an email or text message, or use text input literally anywhere, after switching apps or clicking outside of the input box or some other unknown arbitrary action that Swype decides it just can't handle.
I actually came to the App Store just now not to write this review but to find a replacement for Swype.

I've been using Swype across all of my devices since it's earlier days, I constantly recommend it to anyone I know with an iPhone, and overall absolutely love the ease of use and functionality. Swype offers all the options I want out of a keyboard and more that I hadn't even considered. It has a beautiful and simple UI, and this definitely deserves a huge hat tip to the designers for integrating functionality with the workflow in a stylish way.
Over past several months the keyboard will simply disappear when I try to type within any application. A large grey box appears where the keyboard should be but.. no keyboard.
Ok, just a bit annoying but easy to work around by clicking somewhere else on the app and then back on the text box, and the keyboard pops up normally. We're back in business.

Except for the other times this bug makes my iPhone unusable for typing...which is.. well, the only function a keyboard NEEDS. Once that empty grey box appears I cannot use any keyboard in any app across my entire phone. The only work around I've found is going into the iPhone settings, removing the Swype keyboard and then readding it. Specifically Settings  General  Keyboards  Keyboards  Remove Swype  Add Swype

I really do love this app when it works. I've tried almost every other swipe style keyboard I can find and none of them compare to Swype as I explained earlier... but this bug is beyond being a mild annoyance now and is making me look for another keyboard at this very moment.
I've tried the most popular keyboard, each for a week. G board was probably my favorite under this one. But the predictions weren't as good as swype.
I do wish that this app would inherit the same features as the Android version like word selection, all select, copy and paste etc.

Typing with the regular keyboard is long and monotonous and starts hurting my fingers. I love Swype. But right now writing this review, I am not able to use it. Why Because there is a glitch that sometimes happens quite often once a week where the keyboard gets stuck on the symbols page and doesn't allow me to switch back to the alphabet keyboard. I have to switch back to my normal keyboard for a few hours before it starts working again. If this glitch gets fixed, it's definitely a 5 star app I'll be waiting to change my review Swype Please fix

Keyboard gets stuck on certain apps like snapchat and imessage and cannot type. There is no way to restart the keyboard to fix the glitch. Worst part is when it freezes you can't switch keyboard so you have to disable it to use the Apple keyboard.
For some reason, it worked for three months, but now constantly freezes and just shows the numberpunctuation keyboard. Froze again when I started this review
Literally unusable in iOS 11. I am uninstalling this sad dated POS
Swipe frequently disappears, forcing me to switch to another app, bring up a stable keyboard, and switch back. Pretty pathetic for the premier swiping keyboard. When it works it works.
Literally crashes a few times a day. Only way to fix is to restart my phone. Fix please

This is an absolutely AWFUL addition to your app. I paid for this keyboard. Im now uninstalling it, there are SO MANY bugs. The words change when you hit send, the stupid emojiis are distracting and not at all welcome. I used to love Swype and promoted it to my friends in spite of the issues but not anymore.

I've commented before there's no functional purpose requiring location services be on always or never.  This binary option is for the collection of data plain and simple.  Now popup's  Really  I got an obtrusive message about a SeaTow service which isn't available in my area by the way on screen while I was navigating.  Now I see the true purpose of Navionics alwayson location tracking.  Selling adverts.

I thought smarter app developers were beyond this kind of nonsense.  It's simple if you need the money offer a small fee to users to AVOID this type of disturbance.  Especially while navigating  This is a pretty good app and I use Navionics software on my Raymarine systems.  But the developers are going to ruin it and lose customers with this nonsense.
Love the app but please make it easier to add waypoints. And quit calling them markers, they should be called waypoints.
Used sailing up the North River currently named Hudson River.

I have fished out of a kayak for a long time and have a basic depth finder. This app replaces the need to upgrade to a more expensive unit as it replaces the lake mapping.
If you're simply fishing specific structure lines and specific depths, especially while trolling, this can replace a depth finder completely
Download doesn't work even while on wifi. Basically useless

Frustrating to have to wait fir the map to draw when you pan the screen. Each screen can take 1015 seconds to appear. I like the concept and the map download so you don't need to be online to use it but man is it slow
Asks to agree to terms EVERY time you open the app. This should only be asked during the first screen load.
it's plotted a route through land a few times. App does not seem to shut down when closed or have a way to manualy shut it down

We bought a new boat in Maryland and had to drive it home to the north shore of Long Island through waters we were completely unfamiliar with. The equipment on the boat was not functioning as hoped and this app came to the rescue. Our trip was plotted for us easily and the we found fuel docks with the app and navigated home easily and safely with no problems. Thank you Navionocs
Great app, but doesn't have the option to only use my location when I'm using the app, so it kills my battery. Please fix this feature.

Got this app to help me isolate points and depth for ice fishing. I live in Colorado and our lakes are small granted, but to advertise as an accurate topographical map is an insult. I rue the purchase.

What you see today might not be what you see tomorrow.  I used this app that I purchased to fish flats with the satellite overlay.  Now they have made satellite a subscription service.  What will they take away next

I found the app to be ideal for USA Lakes Super helpful for navigating new waters and knowing the typography of the lake you are fishing. For a 10 app I found it to be feature rich and very user friendly.

This app is horribly inaccurate, it tells me depths that are no where near the actual depths of the areas, on almost every lake I've ever looked at it on, save your money, this app is trash

Neither Navionics nor iTunes will correct this problem because they're both blaming the other for the problem.  Meanwhile, I got burned out of 4.99 FOR NOTHING. This app is amazing for any lake, bay, or ocean. I uploaded the local lake maps of the area and already have the fishing spots ready to go with lures to match the depth of the water. This app is revolutionary and for 9.99 this will be the best tool in your tackle box.
Best 10 bucks I've ever spent on the boat. So helpful, can't describe. Replaced thousands of dollars in paper charts.

this is not worth downloading if it was free.    there are several others available that are free or lower priced that give you must more detail and information on lakes and waterways.    i am really sorry i downloaded this, i hope to review will aid others in not making the same mistake.

Great app. I've been relying on it for years. Recently I notice when using the wind forecast, when I touch the wind speed symbol wind barb the actual wind speed does not appear. In past versions of the app the wind speed would appear after a tap. Please fix this.

Had to sync with my laptop and remove it. Reinstalled it and same screen again. Removed it again and won't reinstall. High risk application.
You can't beat this app for detail I use it in conjunction with my full size plotter and as a backup. Great app  Worth every cent

Although the iPhone app may not be accuratesafe enough for realtime navigation, the disclaimer makes that clear, and the details and technology of the app are excellent for information and planning. The technology and route planning is more sophisticated than many chart plotters, for a fraction of the price. I am a big fan

I use this app in the Pacific Northwest, including the Columbia  Willamette rivers and so far I'm very impressed. I don't really have much to compare it to, but the charts are very detailed and so far extremely accurate.

The plotter page is wonderfully intuitive with easy taptoplace waypoints and very professional speed, BRG, dist next windows. You can input your boat's specs to anticipate leglength and fuel consumption.
It even has a massive search database for locating fuel and any written info on sections of your voyage.
I'm astonished, frankly, to be the first person to write a review here and if I'd seen others, I might have actually rated it a 5.

I am this app all year Great way to plot my ice fishing trips. Instead of plugging a bunch of holes and dropping my flasher I can pick out land marks and get close to where the fish should be. Saved me so much time and effort and got me fishing
Only downfall is I have had to buy this twice I just switched to iPhone and had to purchase it again. There should be a way to port it over.

This is a great app for boating and fishing but it is missing one critical feature  the ability to import markerswaypoints.  There are other GPS and marine apps that have this feature.  I have many lists of GPS coordinates for fishing reefs and there is no way to import them into this app.

I can not say enough how valuable this app is. It's great for planning. Great as a backup electronic navigation device. I don't use it tied to electronics..only on its own. With this and a good case, on both my iPad and iPhone it's a goto thing

Great to get a general layout of the lake. Depth contours can be a little off in their accuracy. If you can figure out which way it's off you're golden. Wanted to fish near a sand bar and stopped short of it on the map but was nearly on top of it. Had to reverse twenty feet or so to find the drop off which then said it should have been shallow again. Good to know where the real shallows and rocks are though.
Don't like how they eat up screen space advertising their other products. Please remove the ads. It is very annoying.
the new update is super dumb, why is it black and it just went down the toilet

The app works great for its intended purpose but it has a flaw that ruins it. For some reason they placed a very light colored link that easily blends into the background to something called openstreet. It is placed right in the middle lower section so almost every time you try to scroll your map, the link will get activated and it takes you to this website and away from your map. It is very worrisome if you are tracking your way points through a tough channel and suddenly your map is gone. I have the paid version of navionics too. If they could get rid of that stupid link it could be a great app.
Good app very accurate and is great for storing your favorite fishing holes.
This is a very useful app with no bugs yet extremely detailed
I like the app. Use it on iPad and iPhone for bass fishing while in the boat. But please, please, please add more icons for waypoints.

Literally the most beneficial fishing tool I have ever came across, specifically when targeting areas ice fishing, due to the fact that, unlike most chat plotters used on open water, most ice flashers do not have any means of navigation or topography. Simply pull out your phone and hop on the sled to quickly target designated contour areas and composition changes. An absolute game changer. Best part... ITS FREE. Why not spend the money on the rods we know your gonna buy anyways because when do we ever stop buying new fishing gear. I will also have you know this is the only app review I have ever written, due mainly because I'm pretty confident I use this app more then the text messaging and calling features on my phone.
Can't continue on tracks anymore and data sync is a pain. Please fix

This gives me exactly what I need for fishing. Contours of lakes. And I couldn't believe how many tiny lakes  on this app have contour data. It's extremely accurate. I ice fish and this saves me from having to drill tons of holes to find the depths And drop offs to fish. Also it's great to be able to download areas so that I don't need cellular coverage to use the maps. Well worth the 10 bucks. Thanks

Can't say enough good things about this app. I boat a lot and always have this app running while I boat. Saved me from running into shallow water. I love looking at the saved tracks and reviewing my trips. Top speed, total distance traveled, ect. Works even where you don't have cell coverage. Just make sure you download the maps a head of time. I am part of an old boat club and recommend this app to everyone. I am amazed by this app every time I use it.

I love this app. I use it for ice fishing and camping a lot. I wish there was a better system for sorting and selecting which waypoints you want displayed on the map. Other than that this is a 105 star app
I use this app all the time when I visit Charleston. Simple and easy for anyone to use. I highly recommend trying it
Honestly if your a fisherman just spend the 10 dollars and you won't regret it one bit Not kidding either. I love this app and use it all the time
If you fish or do any boating this is an app you need

This app is seriously messed up. The map contours never fit the outline of the lake and it constantly moves all over the place. It shows I'm going up to 2mph when I'm laying in my bed looking at it. I have a paid subscription and expect a working app Please fix asap
I stopped using my Garmin chart plotter because this is so much better. The sonar charts are unbelievably accurateto the foot all over the Chesapeake.

This is a must have From the serious tournament fisherman to the weekend guy fishing from the shore. The map lines up well with actual features in the lake. I have recommended this app to 15 people and they find it as useful as I do. If there is one knock on this app it's the fact that you can only have 150 saved icons.
We got lost in the marsh off the sc coast. I downloaded this and we were able to get to our destination and back to the boat ramp very easily. A must have if you don't know the area you are boating.
I find this app useful for freshwater lake navigation. It has some nice features that I really don't need or use, but would be useful for some boaters. A must have if you launch in unfamiliar areas.
I wished I checked the reviews on Navionics before I purchased.

I have had this app for less than 24hrs and I have already found 3 lakes in my area michigans U.P. where I know for a fact because I've fished them there are shallow humps less than 4ft that are on my paper maps but not on these so called contour maps. To use these for navigation on a unfamiliar lake would be a big mistake. If you can't rely on these for navigation how helpful will they really be for fishing Bottom line is cross check the maps on this app with reliable maps from another source.

I take my ski from Orange County to Avalon, CA all the time. I have been in very thick fog before however, the app makes following a direction very easy.
What a bummer The new app will not download routes and tracks. I can not imagine buying a color tv and the next year they upgrade it to BW only.

This app is far and away better than any other navigation app that I have seen. I am having trouble getting all the data from my iPhone to sync with my iPad. I have used practically every system. This is the cheapest, effective way to safely navigate a vessel out there. I recommend it to all of my students and all mariners operating on navigable water.

Best 10 bucks I've ever spent. If you fish it is a must buy.

I spend most of my time fishing along the east coast of Florida in a 20' CC. I thought about buying an expensive GPS unit for my boat but found that Navionics does all that I need. What sold me on this App I put in at a very little off the chart boat ramp one afternoon to go shrimping and the channel out was marked by PCV pipes with shallows on either side.  Coming in well after sunset I could not find these little PVC markers so, Navionics to the rescue I just followed my out bound Track right back in. It put me between these little PCV markers that I could not even see until I was passing them.  Worth every penny and saved me hundred of dollars. No need for a GPS unit.

I use it every time I'm on the water. It's like a water gps in your hand, you can always know the depth of the water before u drive over it.   It's especially great for new lakes bc u don't have to fear unsafe shallow spots.

This app is very easy to use. You can download the map on your phone so in the case that you don't have cell phone coverage you can still see where to go. I just moved to Southern Wisconsin and this has been great for finding lakes, boat ramps and lake topo's  I like how you can mark spots where fishing has been good and making fishing notes. I am very disappointed that I paid ten dollars for this app and then don't get to enjoy any of the real features unless I make additional in app purchases. Not cool.
Love your app, it comes in handy every time I'm fishing in unfamiliar waters, thanks
This is an extraordinary app. It does everything the thousand dollar chart plotters do. I have been amazed at the accuracy and the graphics. Bravo to the development team

Navionics ha done it again hit the nail on the head with this one I use it every time I go out and it has definatley improved my knowledge of fishing I can now eliminate unproductive areas and stay in the sweet spot also they have a great support team they responded quickly to an issue I had and made it right Thanks
This program is a little wonder.  The only problem is not of it's making.  Out on the water in the sun you can't read your cell phone screen
This app is a great back up works just as well if not better than my high dollar Garmin chart plotter
Very accurate and quick response.

Functions that should be the most simple and intuitive creating standalone waypoints or markers as this program calls themare unnecessarily difficult. Best thing that can be said about it is that, unfortunately, it is better than most of the competing apps right now.  Give it a couple years....

I bought the original ap for around 50.  It is useless since the IO7 updates.  Navionics didn't offer a patch but require you to buy the new ap.  I called Navionics and questioned them about upgrading the older ap and they told me that ITunes store required a new purchase.  This is total BS.  I have spent over 1,000 on the Navionics SD cards and Navionics Planner software and then they treat their customers like crap.  I hope LakeMaster is watching and will provide a comparable product in the near future.  I'm through with Navionics
I've used the original navionics app then today I go to use it and it tells me it's not compatible with io7 7 Instead of offering a patch or upgrade they make you buy the app again. Total BS
Great app but when you go to zoom in it crashes.

Works very well showing your location, speed, direction, beacons, and other useful info. Trusting the Noah navigation charts it uses means your trusting Noah which is the industry standard for water depths. Thinking I'll upgrade to the sonar maps option for 4 more just to get the extra info. Thats 14 total. Thanks Navionics very nice water navigation phone app. I use it in the Houston Galveston area for recreational boating.

The map is very detailed and very accurate. The touch interface of my iphone 5 makes it easier to use over my Lawrence system. Tracking features are nice. I did do an in app purchase and upgraded to auto route. This is a neat feature but not necessary. Basically put in your boats draft and it calculates the fastest route within a safe depth.

I payed over 30 for the original version of this app which doesn't even exist in the App Store any more. Instead of a regular app update they instead have abandoned the original app and require one to purchase this new app That's BS, especially now that the old app won't run for more than a minute without crashing with no hope for an update.

I finally upgraded to the new version of this app because of iOS 7. I like many of the features. However, I'm still getting used to nuances with zooming. Also, my biggest issue so far is the text.  It is very difficult to read. Setting the easy view option makes the text bigger, but it also makes all the symbols too big. Why wasn't the font from the old app used It was bolder, antialiased, and much easier to read.

This app does it all link it between your new wifi units with Navionics chip and Navionics app to plan routes and mark waypoints and us Navionics sync to transfer between each other.  Would recommend adding the in app upgrades to get Navionics  for all the freshest data for a year and the newest addition the sonar charts.  With the advances and continual updating of the charts well worth the money.  If you like plotting routes I would recommend you add the navigation module along with autorouting option.  You can't go wrong for the price  Like I said best navigation and chart app in the apple App Store
Worth every penny  This is a steal. It was on point with my buddy's 500 boat nav. But drains your battery , still worth it
App worked great until I tried upgrading. It is now stuck at installing and program is unusable. Why do I always get this issue. how do I fix this?
Bought app along with some of the upgrades.
Problem I have is when I zoom in or scroll around on map it will often close app then I have to start over.
Also map is not very accurate I have found rock pile up to a couple hundred yards from where map says it should be. Would not buy again

This app is amazing I have been looking for a good inland app for the TN river. Every obstacle on the river was marked. I kept telling the crew how lucky we were that I stumbled on this the night before the trip. We had to complete the first leg at night and I honestly think this app got us to our first destination in one piece. Great job' Please keep it updated. What a lifesaver

All of these new features are way cool. If you want a static chart buy a map. If you want the best data available pony up the 4.99 you are getting all the charts for US Lakes  Coastal.  With the new NAV update you receive 12 months of chart updates, and SonarChats. SonarCharts is data that is collected by doing Sonar logs wHumminbird or Garmin chart plotters.
A waste of money. Glitchy, twitchy and inaccurate. Constant hounding to buy upgrades that SHOULD BE INCLUDED UPDATES WHEN YOU BUY A 10 app
If you are looking for detailed depth contours this is not for you. I expected detailed contours but not even close. What makes it worse is that when on the water the contours are way off.
I do like the community edit feature where others can post structure and hot spots but few are willing to share.

When I contacted customer support about lack of contours they stated that Sonar Charts may be included in future updates. Sonar Charts are AWESOME Very high detailed contours and extremely accurate. Unfortunately this feature is only available with the depth finder chips.
With Sonar Charts as a feature of this app I would pay triple.
Navionics, thanks for trying but please work on adding Sonarcharts. Better yet enable communication between my depth finder with Navionic chip and this app and you have a real winner
Was surprised to find Jordanelle Reservoir in Utah still not included opened 20 years ago.
I purchased this app and I wish I didn't. There is no way to create a waypoint list. What's the point of a marine chart if I have no option for waypoints.
I love this app.  I love the depth and rock warnings   Easy to use.  I promise your getting your money's worth the first time you use it   Very surprised how fast and accurate it is on my iphone
Use this as all the time in conjunction with my 1100 GPS and this one is easier to use and the detail is better than my fixed mount the depth contours are great must have for any boater
For 5 bucks it will plot a straight line between 2 waypoints.
The only reason I have it 4 stars is because the iPad version doesn't have course up yet.

I use this app on 2 iPads and my iPhone. It's amazing how you can sync tracks and routes. I've been on my friends boats and used it to tell them how to get somewhere. It's absolutely amazing for planning trips. Again, being able to store all the locations is great. I can pull up any location along with current wind, tide, currents, etc. anytime.
The detail is much better than most hard wired chart plotters.

The reviews are specific to small issues. You have to get the lake version if you want lakes. Auto routing is kind of nice but I could definitely so without. These little things don't merit a 12 star rating. Buy this app. You won't regret it. And, no, I'm not affiliated with the company at all. I just love this app. All the guys on my dock are using it now too.
I thought it would have the depths of the lakes It only has it for the ocean.
The original app is GREAT Don't waste your money on the auto routing upgrade. You still need to enter waypoints. That doesn't make it automatic.
Of the app would stay open under navigation it would of gotten a higher star
The review below originally had one star. Navionics actually resolved the issue and emailed to inform me. WOW

This app is great with plenty of features such as the newly added auto routing.  Recently add ons have been released quite frequently.  The ONLY thing this app lacks is headup that isn't based on the inaccurate iPhone compass heading.  If it used the same method the app uses to point the arrow on the map, it would be perfect.
The app itself is very good. The auto routing update does not work and kept freezing up. It also casused my iphone 4 to crash and have not been able to restore. Stay far away far away.

Awesome app in general Get it well worth it. Minus one star for the new Auto routing inapp purchase...  not as nearly as useful as I had hoped. I expected it to at least follow Navigation rules. And yes boat settings are set correctly. I regret spending money on this inapp purchase . The auto route had me going across sand bars and islands Needs some serious tweaking
Great but many lakes in SD and MN are not correct for depth. Please fix Then would be a 5 star app.
There is no longer an option to adjust current lake depth. This feature is a must have so please add it.

App functions properly and has good menu options. The one huge downfall is that you cannot zoom in far enough to have a good idea what depth your at. Example fishing rivers or lakes with steep dropoffs.

Have used this app for years.  Upgraded to iPhone 5 and the latest operating system.  Then Navionics provided an update.  Now it won't run.  It crashes on startup every time.  Works on my iPad.  Unfortunately, I don't always have my iPad with me when I am am talking fishing with my friends.  My iPhone is there.

I'm not sure what happened.  It was working fine, and then one day decided to crash.  I've deleted and reloaded the app several times.  It works for the first time, and then after I've navigated away from it, I can't relaunch.  It looks like it starts, and then crash.
Just upgraded to the newest version. Crash bug remains. Fix it

Marked a spot ice fishing and could not get back on the structure using this app.  The crib was on the map but way off and my actual GPS location was off as well.  Made it impossible to find my spot again.

I bought the 5 in app upgrade because everything navionics has done so far has been great. This was a waste. They add some minor functionality that available for free in several other places. This better not be an indicator of things to come.
It's a pitty that app functionality updates such as the nav module and advanced map options are extra.

Overall it's a great app. You can study the lake wherever your at. I have navionics on my boat, computer, iPad, and iPhone. The only downfall of this app is that the iPhone won't sync waypoints. Apparently at one time it did because I do have some on the iPhone that are on other devices too but I guess one of the navionics updates might have messed it up.

Got lost out in the river in the thickest fog I'd ever seen. This app is the ONLY reason we made it home. We drove in circles out there for an hour and a half before I finally found this and purchased it. Worth every penny.
Still not taking advantage of iphone 5 screen size. Wont sync between ipad and iphone. Disappointing.
Worth every penny for finding some sweet ice fishing spots.
Good App, but there is a limit of only 200 waypointsmarkers you can save. Please add more.
If you fish much, you can use up that limit very easy.
Tried to open yesterday and the initializing screen loads, and loads and loads, but the app doesn't launch.  Had worked fine sine purchasing this summer.  I love this app but.......
Works great Works for iPhone 5 screen size. Would have given 5 stars if there was a water level offset.

Great app however, I boat on the upper Niagara River and Lake Erie. Since both these waters are an international boarder, there is no coverage of Canadian waters. It would be great if these boarder areas were included.

Caveat emptor as app uses true not magnetic for course and direction. If you are in an area of high magnetic variation and do not account for it manually then you will miss your mark. Remember 1 degree of course error in 60 miles is 1 mile.

I've been using this app to navigate from the Chesapeake Bay area down to Florida and love it I'm delivering a 50 foot catamaran and the electronics on board are useless. I've had to rely on this app on both my iPhone and iPad and it had been extremely helpful. The ease of use is great, accuracy has not been a problem, and pulling into new inlets every night has been easy with this app.

It does have a few issues. I use the track quite often to see the days progress. The problem is I leave the app running in the background and it usually crashes about twice a day. When it does this the track line is connected with a dotted line to show what it missed, which is great. However, the information at the end of the day is not correct due to it keeps the same start time, but only tells the tracks distance from the last startup point. This makes the total distance, average speed, and fuel consumption way off.

I purchased this app on a fishing trip in Michigan's upper peninsula. I used it a couple of times and found it to be quite accurate and helpful. On the third outing we had a dense fog roll in and that's when I found out just how useful it can be.
I was able to stay clear of shallow waters and navigate a route back to our lodge. The soundings correlated with my fish finder which made motoring much easier.
I would recommend this to anyone looking for a navigational aid. As a note, not all lakes show contours, but I think you'll find most, if not all, popular lakes listed.

I use the app on iphone  ipad reference at home for planning.  On the kayak, use it for trips.  Works great.  Easy to expand map for little creeks a kayak can enjoy.  Tide  current planning great for figuring when to go.  Really helps enjoy the trips.  Highly recommend it.
This app was just updated for iOS 6. Did you miss the launch of the iPhone 5 Please update for iPhone 5 and ill rewrite my review.
Great app in Alaska some common sense and alertness on foggy days but

The app functions well, but upon checking the soundings where I work, in New York harbor and where I live, in Annapolis, I found them to be wildly inaccurate. It shows 3 feet if water where the U.S. Sailboat show is currently setting up deepdraft boats for display. In New York harbor, it shows less than 20 feet of water in Northern Stapleton anchorage, where deepdraft ships are anchored. Don't rely on the soundings.
You guys should add the ability to use TD's instead of LatLong
I fish about 34 times a week. Never have had a problem with this app. I love it, mark my spots and helps finding new ones. Fish on

I am impressed with this program. It works very well for a back up to my full system and for the price I think it is well worth it. The one issue I have with it is the overlays do not seem to fit where they belong. If I had a small boat and a smart phone this would certainly be one  great app to have
Shows great contour lines and you can plug in coordinates and mark your own waypoints

A must have for tournament fisherman who want to get a better image of the lake and contours while in your hotel room or at the house and not having to be out on the water or using your Lowrance HDS  A
THis is one of the best tools to have to show anglers about the Navionics Mapping system that could be used on the GPS systems on thier boats. It's always with you and can be used anytime.
Kept me in the channel all the way up Lake of the Ozarks to Truman Dam. Easy to use and spot on.

Don't buy the app and think you've got the content, it's just an app.  The map downloads are free until updated, but they must be downloaded separately.  If you try to use the app without a wifi connection you'll find yourself needing to download 100MB of maps over your cell connection, or worse.
There should be an easy way to say download all and get all the maps you've paid for in one step.  Then you could do that at home and forget about it.

Sweet app out of the box on my 3GS. I was looking for depth charts for the Tennessee river lakes in North Alabama Guntersville, Wheeler, Wilson, and Pickwick. I'm glad I ignored most of the negative reviews. Within minutes I had 500 MB of charts downloaded covering a large chunk of the southeast at no added cost. Resolution is great and accurate so far according to my sonar. Community overlays are a sweet feature too. App also allows overlays of mapping services Google, Bing, etc. Great app so far, and well worth 10. Now I don't need to spend 20 per lake for paper maps

I purchased one of their charts and when I got a new Iphone I could not locate the App in the purchased and Not on this phone section. The chart was fine.
